title: What's the reason behind retiring Sweetheart Xayah and Rakan?

body:
#Unrequited Love

I understand that Valentines skins are among the many skin lines that are based around events and are thus legacy. But the whole reason for keeping them out was that Xayah and Rakan had no other available skins.

I don't see what has changed?

Yea they got SSG skins. which unless I'm mistaken, are also unavailable?

I can see both sides here, Valentines skins are seen as legacy, so for the players who already have them, its nice to have a little bit of exclusivity _(who doesn't like to feel special? Especially when its your favourite champ). _ And they were marketed as part of a skin line that is now known for being legacy content.

However: Unless you have secret brand-spanking new skins for them ready to release next patch, you'll be essentially reverting a champion _(technically two champions)_ back to only having their release skin available?  So any new players, will be in the exact same situation as players were **2 whole years ago**. _(just with the added bonus of seeing other people have skins, but just being unable to get them yourself)._

Two champs with nothing but release skins available, two years after they debuted.  
Isn't that very much a step in the wrong direction?


It's just my opinion of course, but I think allowing players to have a selection of skins for a champ _(as opposed to just one)_, is more important than making a few existing players feel special 
about their purchases.

If we have to retire skins _(which I must admit i'm not really a fan of to begin with)_, maybe Lux or Yi or someone with skins to spare might be more palatable?
